titleStmt.title: Gädlä Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Vita of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]” / Mälkәʾa Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Image of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]” / Dәrsanä sänbätä krәstiyan “Homily on the Christian Sabbath”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.title: III. Dәrsanä sänbätä krәstiyan “Homily on the christian Sabbath” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the word sälam; names of the donors; four lines on the incipit page (fol. 3r) of Text I, divided into two groups, alternating with black lines; five lines on the incipit page (fol. 19r) of Text II, divided into three groups, alternating with black lines; seven lines on the incipit page (fol. 27r) of Text III divided into four groups, alternating with black lines; some lines (1-3) in the paragraph beginning of Text I and Text III; the word Ṣadәqan (in Text I); the words sänbät, sänbätä krәstiyan and sänbätәyä (in Text III); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

msItem.title: II. Mälkәʾa Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Image of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the word sälam; names of the donors; four lines on the incipit page (fol. 3r) of Text I, divided into two groups, alternating with black lines; five lines on the incipit page (fol. 19r) of Text II, divided into three groups, alternating with black lines; seven lines on the incipit page (fol. 27r) of Text III divided into four groups, alternating with black lines; some lines (1-3) in the paragraph beginning of Text I and Text III; the word Ṣadәqan (in Text I); the words sänbät, sänbätä krәstiyan and sänbätәyä (in Text III); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

explicit.foreign: Fol. 22v, l.14: … According to my ability. If I embellished your story, Righteous Ones, and if I did offer a lot with toils, the grace of your name(s) and your labors, add upon (what I wrote).

msItem.title: I. Gädlä Ṣadәqan [zä-Baräknaha] “Vita of the Righteous Ones [of Baräknaha]”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the word sälam; names of the donors; four lines on the incipit page (fol. 3r) of Text I, divided into two groups, alternating with black lines; five lines on the incipit page (fol. 19r) of Text II, divided into three groups, alternating with black lines; seven lines on the incipit page (fol. 27r) of Text III divided into four groups, alternating with black lines; some lines (1-3) in the paragraph beginning of Text I and Text III; the word Ṣadәqan (in Text I); the words sänbät, sänbätä krәstiyan and sänbätәyä (in Text III); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

explicit.foreign: Fol. 17va l.3: … and your wine and your fig will become verdant and your regions will rejoice. And your mountains will be glad of her till the enemy will do homage to you. Forever and ever. Amen.

listBibl.bibl: Ms. from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea),
Ms. (now missing) from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea),

msItem.colophon: justify">Fols. 17va l.13–18ra: ተፈጸመ፡ መጸሐፈ[sic]፡ ገድሎሙ፡ ለጻድቃን፡ ዘቤት፡ ምካእ፡ ወሰሞሙኒ፡ ባሮ፡ ባርኮስ፡ ሲማኮስ፡ ኤርምያስ። ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወበረከቶሙ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሮ[sic]፡ ገብረ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወምስለ፡ ዓመቶሙ፡ አመተ፡ ክርስቶስ፡[fol. 17vb] አመተ፡ ማርያም፡ ወምስለ፡ ደቂቁ፡ ዓመተ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወለተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ኂሩተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ገብረ፡ ዋሕድ፡ ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ሰማዕያን፡ ወአንባብያን፡ ወዘጌሠ፡ ኀበ፡ መቃብሪሆሙ፡ ለእሉ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ነሢኦ፡ ዕጣነ፡ ወወይነ፡ ወሰርናየ፡ ቅብዓ፡ ወማኅቶተ፡ ወስምዐ[sic]፡ ወርቀ፡ ወብሩረ፡ ይነሥእ፡ ዐስበ፡ ወእሴተ፡ ክብረ፡ ወጽድቀ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ወይበውእ፡ ኀበ፡ ሃለዉ፡ ጻድቃን፡ በትእዛዘ፡ አምላክ፡ ወይወርስ፡ ሕይወተ፡ ዘለዓለም፡ ወዘንተ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ወሀቦሙ፡ ለጻድቃኒሁ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ወበረከቶሙ፡[fol. 18ra] የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብሮሙ፡ ገብረ፡ ሥላሴ፡The book is here entitled “Gädlomu lä-Ṣadәqan zä-Bet Mәkaʾ”, “Vita of the Righteous Ones of the church of Mәkaʾ”. However, the text is the same as the text included in the Ms. from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea) and published by Conti Rossini (Ms. from the church of Baräknaha (Eritrea), (publ. Conti Rossini 1903; tr. Rainieri 1979)).

supportDesc.condition: Cuts carefully amended in fols. 1, 2, 14, 25. Holes in fols. 9, 19, 32.

layout.ab: Structural pricks are partly visible (e.g., s. fols. 21v, 22r).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: II. Four dot asterisk (e.g. fols.: 3va, ls. 21, 22; 15rb, l.2; 42v, l.4);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
five red and black dot vertical colon (used throughout the text).
III. Three four dot asterisk (esp. fol. 22va, l.22);
three nine dot asterisks (esp. fol. 17va, l.12);
more nine dot asterisks (esp. fol. 43r, l.9);
more than two nine dot asterisks, connected with dashes (esp. fol. 18ra, ls. 20-21);
chain of black and red dots (esp. fol. 22va, l.23).
- Crude notes in pen and crude drawings: fols. 1r, 3r, 18v, 22v, 23r, 24r, 26rv. - Crude notes in pen also on the front cover, and crude drawing on the inner part of it.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the back one is broken and skillfully repaired with wire rings); Two pairs of sewing stations.
Small holes visible in the spine folds of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

origPlace.placeName: Däbrä Sahәl Qәddus Mikaʾel Bet Mäḵaʿ / DSM

origin.origDate: According to Additio 1 the Ms. was donated in 1935 A.D.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: ʾaläqa Rädda Mälläs is mentioned as the donor according to the colophon. Gäbrä Śәllase is mentioned in supplication formulas (e.g., s. fols. 3ra, l.15; 10rb, ls. 19-19; 17va; 33r, ls. 10-11; 42v, ls. 19-20). Besides, in the colophon and elsewhere many other individuals (his relatives) are mentioned: ʿAmätä Krәstos (e.g., fols. 3ra, ls. 15-16; 12ra, ls. 24-25; 17va); Wälättä Maryam (fols. 3ra, ls. 16-17; 10rb, ls. 21-22); Wälättä Krәstos (fol. 10rb, ls. 20-21); ʿAmätä Maryam (fols. 17vb; 41r, ls. 2-3; 43r, l.4); ʿAmätä Yoḥannәs (fol. 17vb); Wälättä Śәllase (fol. 17vb); Wälättä Ṣadqan (fols. 17vb); Ḫirutä Śәllase (fol. 17vb); Gäbrä Waḥәd (fol. 17vb).
